exit_code.description: Error occurred. Please check Tool Standard Error

param.label: Learning rate
param.help: float >= 0

param.label: epsilon
param.help: Fuzz factor. If `None`, defaults to `K.epsilon()`

param.label: decay
param.help: Learning rate decay over each update.

param.label: Activation function
param.option: None / linear (default)
softmax
elu
selu
softplus
softsign
relu
tanh
sigmoid
hard_sigmoid
tanh

param.label: @ARGUMENT@
param.option: zero / zeros / Zeros
one / ones / Ones
constant / Constant
normal / random_normal / RandomNormal
uniform / random_uniform / RandomUniform
truncated_normal / TruncatedNormal
orthogonal / Orthogonal
identity / Identity
glorot_normal
glorot_uniform
he_normal
he_uniform
lecun_normal
lecun_uniform

param.label: @ARGUMENT@
param.help: (l1, l2). l1/l2: float; L1/l2 regularization factor. (0., 0.) is equivalent to `None`
Integer or list of integers. axis along which to calculate weight norms

param.label: @ARGUMENT@
param.option: None (default)
maxnorm / max_norm / MaxNorm
nonneg / non_neg / NonNeg
unitnorm / unit_norm / UnitNorm
min_max_norm / MinMaxNorm

param.help: the maximum norm for the incoming weights.
the minimum norm for the incoming weights.
the maximum norm for the incoming weights.
rate for enforcing the constraint.

param.label: units
param.help: Positive integer, dimensionality of the output space.
Fraction of the input units to drop.
1D integer tensor representing the shape of the binary dropout mask that will be multiplied with the input.
A Python integer to use as random seed.
The ordering of the dimensions in the inputs.
param.option: channels_last
channels_first

param.help: A shape tuple (integer), not including the batch size.For instance, `shape=(32,)`
The data type expected by the input
param.option: float32
float64
int32
int64

param.help: Tuple of integers. Does not include the batch axis.
Tuple of integers. Permutation pattern, does not include the samples dimension. Indexing starts at 1. For instance, (2, 1) permutes the first and second dimension of the input.
repetition factor
The function to be evaluated. Only lambda function is supported!
L1 regularization factor (positive float).
L2 regularization factor (positive float).
Masks a sequence by using a mask value to skip timesteps.
Fraction of the input units to drop.
Fraction of the input units to drop.

param.option: channels_last - the channels dimension (the depth) is at index 3
channels_first - the channels dimension (the depth) is at index 1

param.help: Fraction of the input units to drop.

param.option: channels_last - the channels dimension (the depth) is at index 4
channels_first - the channels dimension (the depth) is at index 1

xml.name: layer_Conv1D

param.help: the dimensionality of the output space (i.e. the number of output filters in the convolution).
An integer or tuple/list of a single integer, specifying the length of the 1D convolution window.
An integer or tuple/list of a single integer, specifying the stride length of the convolution.

xml.section:
valid - no padding same - output has the same length as the original input causal - causal (dilated) convolutions
channels_last - inputs with shape (batch, steps, channels) channels_first - inputs with shape (batch, channels, steps)
\

xml.name: layer_Conv2D

param.help: the dimensionality of the output space (i.e. the number of output filters in the convolution).
An integer or tuple/list of 2 integers, specifying the height and width of the 2D convolution window.
An integer or tuple/list of 2 integers, specifying the strides of the convolution along the height and width.

xml.section:
valid - no padding same - output has the same length as the original input
channels_last - inputs with shape (batch, height, width, channels) channels_first - inputs with shape (batch, channels, height, width)
\

param.help: Integer, size of the max pooling windows.

param.name: strides
param.help: Integer, or None. Factor by which to downscale. E.g. 2 will halve the input. If None, it will default to pool_size.

same - output has the same length as the original input

valid - no padding

valid - no padding same - output has the same length as the original input

param.help: int > 0. Size of the vocabulary, i.e. maximum integer index + 1.
int >= 0. Dimension of the dense embedding.
Length of input sequences. Required if connecting Flatten then Dense layers upstream

param.name: merging_layers
param.label: Type the layer index numbers in a list
param.help: List of numbers

expand.help: Integer or tuple of integers, axis or axes along which to take the dot product.

param.label: Whether to L2-normalize samples along the dot product axis before taking the dot product?

param.help: float >= 0. Negative slope coefficient.
the axes along which to share learnable parameters for the activation function. E.g. [1, 2]
scale for the negative factor.
float >= 0. Threshold location of activation.
Integer, axis along which the softmax normalization is applied.
float >= 0. Maximum activation value.
float >= 0. Negative slope coefficient.
float. Threshold value for thresholded activation.

param.name: inbound_nodes
param.label: Type the index number of input layer
param.help: Find the index number at the left top corner of layer configuration box
